items.content_html:
bt.ht

Stop Using Custom Web Fonts

I‚Äôm not sure I agree with Brad here. Well, for the most part I do, but I have a font on my site, and I use it because I really like how it looks. That all, that‚Äôs the reason. üòä

I‚Äôve also had a few people comment about the font, so some people clearly do appreciate custom fonts. Agree though, performance still needs to be a key factor.
items.content_text:
[bt.ht](https://bt.ht/webfonts)

> Stop Using Custom Web Fonts

I‚Äôm not sure I agree with Brad here. Well, for the most part I do, but I have a font on my site, and I use it because I really like how it looks. That all, that‚Äôs the reason. üòä

I‚Äôve also had a few people comment about the font, so *some* people clearly do appreciate custom fonts. Agree though, performance still needs to be a key factor.

items.content_html:
I hear a lot of Americans saying ‚ÄúI went for a hike today‚Ä¶‚Äù in posts that are accompanied by often beautiful pictures of the US vast and varied landscape.

But what is ‚Äúa hike‚Äù to your average American? Because to me (British), a hike is a 20 mile hike up a large hill/mountain. Is it the same?
